::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**M1.6 Subtidal rocky reefs**](/efg-info/M1_6.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/M1_6_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: M1.6.web.orig v1.0.

> These are ecosystem functional groups that are widespread through the global extent of the marine shelf biome. Reliable data on their precise distribution are limited. To represent regional uncertainty, their indicative distributions were mapped in as minor occurrences through the full extent of the marine ‘shelf’ base layer as mapped by Harris et al. (2014b). Occurrences were converted to 30 arc second spatial resolution.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**GSFM-2014** (Harris PT et al. 2014):

Source of _topography and geomorphology_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: quantitative (subsets).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset   |url                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|:---------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|GSFM-2014 |<http://www.bluehabitats.org/?page_id=9>{target='links'} :: <https://www.grida.no/publications/112>{target='links'} :: <https://www.dropbox.com/s/jvaprrz8snnzvfo/global%20seafloor%20geomorphic%20features%20map.zip?dl=0>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Reclassification*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Coarse quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Indirect,general*.

Ground observations are _no_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Quantitative accuracy assessment,undocumented*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Indicative Map (**code: M1.6.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: M1.6.web.orig**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**M1.6.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.6.IM.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

**M1.6.web.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/M1.6.web.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090935){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.M1_6_web_orig){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map have similar licenses, but please check the license information below.

## References

References used in this version of the maps.

- Harris PT, Macmillan-Lawler M, Rupp J, Baker EK (2014) *Geomorphology of the oceans*. **Marine Geology** 352: 4-24. [10.1016/j.margeo.2014.01.011](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.margeo.2014.01.011)
